title: Has music played an important role in your life? If so, what has it done for you? - Quora

response.answer_text: Music has been a huge part of my life for almost 10 years now. As a kid, I was pretty indifferent to music as an art form. Sure, there were songs I liked, but none that I really sought out. But around age 13, that began to change. I started finding more and more songs I really liked, and started listening to them any chance I got. Then, in 2009, when I was 14 years old, it happened. I got an iPod for Christmas.  Sure, it was one of those tiny little iPod Shuffles. The ones that barely held 200 songs. (Does anyone remember these things, by the way?) But, man, that Christmas morning I couldn’t care less. I could finally listen to the music I loved wherever and whenever I wanted! And from there, my love of music just continued to blossom. In the years since I got that first iPod, music has been almost like a best friend to me. It’s there to comfort me when I’m sad. Calm me down when I’m angry. Pump me up when I’m out for a run. Pat me on the back and tell me “I know what you’re going through, even when it feels like no one else does.” There’s also just this…this rush that I get from listening to a really good song. It’s the kind of thing that’s hard to put into words. Hearing a really good song for the first time is almost like getting your first kiss, or eating your favourite food…there’s just this adrenaline rush that comes with it, and it’s amazing. Ever since 2009 or so I’ve fallen deeper and deeper in love with music as an art form. I’m almost constantly listening to music. I can talk about music all day. There are hundreds of albums, thousands of songs, that I absolutely love, and that have legitimately improved my life just by existing. For the past decade, music has been a huge part of my life. And I don’t see that changing anytime soon.
